isis.stitle: FRONT STEER AXLE: EATON EFA-12 - INSPECT - TYPICAL BEARING FAILURES

svcsubproc.title: Normal Wear and Pitting ( Figure 20)
svcsubproc.para: The slight defects on the cup surface and cone rollers are indications of normal wear. However, upon closer inspection you will note three or four pits starting on the cup. Under continued operation, this bearing would not last.

svcsubproc.title: Pitted and Spalled ( Figure 21)
svcsubproc.para: Surface Fatigue FailureThis bearing is in the advanced stages of corrosion or etching. Heavy pitting and spalling has occurred. Corrosion damage is usually caused by water or other contaminants in the lube.

svcsubproc.title: Chipped and Spalled, Surface Fatigue Failure ( Figure 22)
svcsubproc.para: This bearing shows damage at the extreme end of the roller and cup contact surface. Metal surfaces of the rollers are chipping and spalling, and it is also occurring on the cup.

svcsubproc.title: Pitted and Spalled, Surface Fatigue Failure ( Figure 23)
svcsubproc.para: This bearing is in an advanced stage of pitting and spalling.
For more information on wheel bearing inspection, refer to S02002, Hubs, Bearings, and Seals in GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
